description: Scoring criteria for evaluating kick_off papers (frequently-cited references) for LRD research support on a 0-10 scale

scoring_categories.name: Direct LRD Connection
scoring_categories.description: How directly the paper connects to Little Red Dots or very similar high-redshift populations

evaluation_criteria.indicator: Explicitly studies LRDs, HBA, blue-excess AGN, or compact red galaxies at z>4
Provides theoretical framework specifically for LRD formation/evolution scenarios
Studies very similar populations (overmassive BHs, high-z AGN, compact galaxies) with clear LRD relevance
Investigates high-z black hole growth or AGN physics applicable to LRDs
General AGN/galaxy research with potential but unstated connection to LRDs
Standard astrophysics topics without clear high-z or compact object connection
No meaningful connection to LRDs or related phenomena

scoring_categories.name: LRD Community Citation Frequency
scoring_categories.description: How frequently this paper is cited by LRD researchers (lrdIndex field)

evaluation_criteria.indicator: lrdIndex ≥ 50 (extremely frequently cited, cornerstone paper)
lrdIndex 30-49 (highly cited, major reference)
lrdIndex 20-29 (frequently cited, important reference)
lrdIndex 15-19 (moderately cited, useful reference)
lrdIndex 10-14 (minimum threshold, occasional reference)
lrdIndex < 10 (below threshold, should be in kick_off.bib)

scoring_categories.note: Citation frequency is scaled logarithmically to prevent top-cited papers from dominating. Papers with lrdIndex < 10 should not be in kick_off.bib per library/kick_off_papers.py criteria.

scoring_categories.name: Foundational Knowledge Value
scoring_categories.description: Value of the physical concepts, theories, or frameworks for understanding LRD science (beyond basic AI knowledge)
key_concepts: black hole-galaxy coevolution at high redshift
overmassive / supermassive black hole formation scenarios
Eddington ratio and super-Eddington accretion physics
dust obscuration and Compton-thick absorption in AGN
black hole seeding models (direct collapse, light seeds)

evaluation_criteria.indicator: Introduces novel concepts critical for LRD interpretation (new paradigms, resolves debates)
Provides comprehensive framework for LRD-relevant physics (BH-galaxy coevolution, early growth)
Investigates specific LRD-relevant phenomena with detailed analysis
Useful but incremental advancement to LRD foundation knowledge
Reviews well-established concepts AI should already know (basic AGN unification, standard accretion disks)
Textbook-level physics or generic astrophysics knowledge
No clear value for LRD understanding

scoring_categories.name: Methodological Innovation for LRDs
scoring_categories.description: Novel observational/analysis techniques demonstrated on LRD-like objects or applicable to LRD research

evaluation_criteria.indicator: Pioneering JWST technique (NIRSpec PRISM/gratings, IFS) demonstrated on high-z compact objects
Innovative analysis method for BH mass measurements, Eddington ratios, or dust properties at z>4
Multi-wavelength approach combining JWST with X-ray, ALMA, or other facilities for AGN studies
Useful method demonstrated on related populations (high-z AGN, compact galaxies)
Standard analysis techniques without novel application
General JWST instrument documentation without science applications
Pure methodology paper not demonstrated on relevant objects

scoring_categories.name: Evolutionary Context & Analogs
scoring_categories.description: Provides comparative studies or evolutionary links essential for interpreting LRDs

evaluation_criteria.indicator: Studies very similar high-z populations (z>4 AGN, HBA, blue-excess AGN) with direct evolutionary implications
Low-z analogs with explicit theoretical connection to LRD evolution pathways
High-z galaxy evolution studies relevant to LRD host properties or formation
Comparative studies that contextualize LRDs within broader AGN/galaxy populations
General high-z research without clear analog connection
Low-z studies without evolutionary relevance to LRDs
No contextual value for LRD understanding

8-10.label: Critical Foundation
8-10.description: Essential paper for understanding LRD research. Directly connects to LRDs, highly cited by community, and provides unique value beyond general AI knowledge.

6-7.label: High Value Supporting
6-7.description: Important supporting literature with strong LRD connections or foundational value. Useful for deeper context.
6-7.notebooklm_action: Include if space permits after 8+ score papers

4-5.label: Moderate Value
4-5.description: Useful background but lower priority. May overlap with AI's existing knowledge or provide tangential support.
4-5.notebooklm_action: Consider inclusion if very specific niche needed

0-3.label: Low Priority / Exclude
0-3.description: Too general (textbook knowledge), tangential to LRDs, or better suited as external reference rather than NotebookLM source.

automatic_low_score: Textbook-level AGN physics (unification, basic accretion disks, standard cosmology)
General JWST instrument documentation without specific science applications
Pure methodology papers not demonstrated on LRD-like objects
Low-redshift studies without explicit evolutionary connection to high-z
Standard astrophysics concepts that AI models should already know
Papers with lrdIndex < 10 (should not be in kick_off.bib)
require_explicit_connection: Must mention or directly apply to: LRDs, compact red galaxies, z>4 AGN, HBA, blue-excess AGN
OR provide critical framework for: BH-galaxy coevolution, early BH growth, high-z accretion physics
OR demonstrate innovative JWST techniques applicable to LRD studies

boost_factors: Explicitly mentions Little Red Dots or very similar populations
Resolves key debates in high-z black hole growth or AGN physics
Pioneering JWST technique demonstrated on relevant populations
Provides theoretical framework for overmassive BHs or early SMBH formation
Published in high-impact journal (Nature, Science, ApJL, MNRAS)
reduce_factors: Only mentions LRD-related topics in literature review or introduction
Reviews well-established physics without novel contributions
Focuses on low-z phenomena without evolutionary connection
General survey paper without LRD-specific analysis
Pure methodology without application to high-z or compact objects
Basic AGN/galaxy evolution AI should already know

usage_instructions.prompt_template:
You are an expert astrophysics reviewer specializing in high-redshift AGN, black hole evolution, and Little Red Dot (LRD) research. Evaluate the provided kick_off paper's value as supporting literature for LRD research.

CONTEXT: This paper is from kick_off.bib, meaning it has been cited 10+ times by LRD researchers. The lrdIndex (citation count from LRD papers) is: {lrdIndex}.

CRITICAL: LRD researchers already know basic AGN physics, standard accretion disk theory, and general high-z galaxy evolution. Focus on what UNIQUE value this paper provides beyond textbook knowledge.

Score the paper on a 0-10 scale based on the criteria in kick_off_ranking_criteria.json. For each category:
1. Evaluate the paper against the evaluation criteria
2. Assign a score (0-10) for that category
3. Weight the category score according to its importance
4. Calculate final weighted average

Return ONLY a valid JSON object with this exact structure:
{
  "category_scores": {
    "direct_lrd_connection": {"score": 8.5, "reasoning": "..."},
    "citation_frequency": {"score": 9.0, "reasoning": "lrdIndex={lrdIndex}, indicates..."},
    "foundational_value": {"score": 7.0, "reasoning": "..."},
    "methodological_innovation": {"score": 8.0, "reasoning": "..."},
    "evolutionary_context": {"score": 7.5, "reasoning": "..."}
  },
  "final_score": 8.2,
  "justification": "2-3 sentence summary of why this paper received this score",
  "key_factors": ["lrdIndex={lrdIndex}", "Direct LRD mention", "Critical BH-galaxy coevolution framework", "JWST NIRSpec technique"],
  "notebooklm_recommendation": "Critical foundation for NotebookLM"
}

Be objective, specific, and consider whether AI models would already know the content.
special_considerations: Papers with lrdIndex > 50 are clearly critical and should score highly unless content is very generic
Kick_off papers should NOT be basic AGN textbooks - AI should already know unification, standard accretion physics
Prioritize papers that connect to LRD-specific challenges: overmassive BHs, high-z accretion, compact morphology
Methodological papers must demonstrate techniques on relevant objects (high-z AGN, compact galaxies), not just describe instruments
Low-z analogs are valuable ONLY if they explicitly discuss evolutionary connections to high-z
Review/survey papers can score highly if they synthesize LRD-specific concepts, not just general knowledge
Theoretical papers should provide testable predictions or frameworks for LRD properties

lrdIndex_guidance.scaling: Citation frequency is valuable but not everything. A paper with lrdIndex=50 covering basic AGN physics should score lower than a paper with lrdIndex=15 introducing novel LRD-relevant concepts.
lrdIndex_guidance.context: Use lrdIndex as one signal among many. High lrdIndex + high relevance = 9-10 score. High lrdIndex + low relevance = 5-7 score. Low lrdIndex + high relevance = 7-8 score.
